channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Update Multi-Patient Traffic Collision; INC#0999; 04:15PM; 14961 W Hubbard St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L</a>; #Sylmar; Four vehicle traffic collision with one vehicle overturned. No entrapment. *Eight patients* total. 2 declined hospital transport. Six patients were taken to area hospitals by LAFD Paramedics: Two adults in serious condition, 4 children (ages 6-12) with minor injuries. Though seatbelts were used, some of the children were improperly restrained (No car seats in use, at least two children sharing one seat belt). Thankfully, none of the passengers were ejected from the vehicle(s). Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #2925). "As we enter this Memorial Day weekend, the Los Angeles Fire Department joins law enforcement officials in reminding you to drive sober, avoid distractions, follow speed limits and always buckle up. If you see an impaired driver, call 9-1-1 immediately."; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E18 E287 E298 E7 E75 EM12 EM14 EM15 EM5 RA107 RA75 RA828 RA89 RA891 RA898 RA91 RA96 RA98 T75 T87 T98; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Multi-Patient Traffic Collision; INC#0999; 02:58PM; 14961 W Hubbard St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L</a>; #Sylmar; PRELIM: Multi-vehicle traffic collision with as many as nine patients.; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E7 E75 EM14 EM15 EM5 RA107 RA75 RA828 RA89 RA898 RA891 RA91 RA98 T75; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#0396; 08:31AM; Tujunga Wash; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/ULndatrrrN8bsh948" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/ULndatrrrN8bsh948</a>; #ShadowHills; PRELIM: LAFD ground crews assisting LAPD Foothill Division (Incident #1277) and Medical Examiner with the recovery of a person discovered deceased (undetermined age / gender / body condition / affiliation / circumstances) by a hiker in remnant floodwater along a remote section of the Tujunga Wash flood control channel. No further details.; FS 24; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; E274 E275 EM12 RA74 T74; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Auto Rollover; INC#1204; 06:50PM; 17010 W Sunset Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bsjt50" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bsjt50</a>; #PacificPalisades; Crews found one overturned vehicle, which came to rest against a two-story apartment building. Firefighters provided medical assessment and ongoing care en route to the hospital to three patients (2 serious, 1 moderate). Three others were in good-to-fair condition and received an assessment and care on scene, but declined ambulance transport. LAPD Inc #3938.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E23 E269 E69 EM14 EM17 EM9 RA23 RA59 RA69 RA837 RA862 T69; CH4; 12; Nicholas Prange

Auto Rollover; INC#1204; 05:49PM; 17010 W Sunset Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bsjt50" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bsjt50</a>; #PacificPalisades; Firefighters are on scene of a rollover crash involving a structure. No patients trapped. Preliminary reports suggest there are 6 patients requiring medical aid.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E23 E269 E69 EM14 EM17 EM9 RA23 RA59 RA69 RA837 RA862 T69; CH4; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0235; 05:36AM; 3865 W Boyce Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3QTuNim" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3QTuNim</a>; #AtwaterVillage; *Address Tentative* 30 LAFD Firefighters took 26 minutes (6:02 AM) to extinguish flames in a one-story home that was well involved with fire on their arrival. No injury. Fire cause under active investigation.; FS 50; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E201 E220 E235 E35 E44 E55 E56 EM5 RA35 RA850 SO1 T1 T20 T35; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

ADVISORY; 10:00AM; Hansen Dam Recreation Area; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/9g71V5nJLJgDzeMQA" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/9g71V5nJLJgDzeMQA</a>; #LakeViewTerrace; As a result of first responders training for future wildfires, residents of foothill communities near the Hansen Dam Recreation Area in the northeast San Fernando Valley may notice an ongoing presence of public safety aircraft, including fire department helicopters periodically flying in formation, until 2:00 PM today. There is NO emergency and no need for public action. Again, this is a one day only training involving public safety aircraft and ground personnel that will conclude by 2:00 PM. We appreciate the community's support as our agencies prepare together to battle future wildfires.; - Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire 05/19/2024 INC#0178

item.description: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0178; 04:53AM; 1624 Schrader Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3QPLHye" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3QPLHye</a>; #Hollywood; It took the relentless and well-coordinated effort of 127 LAFD Firefighters just 98 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy fire in the sub-floor/basement, both above ground floors and attic of a vacant and abandoned two-story hotel. No injuries reported. Fire cause under active investigation. LAFD Public Information Officer - Firefighter David Ortiz, is en route to assist the media, with an ETA of 5:20 AM.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E20 E203 E211 E220 E226 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E3 E37 E41 E60 E61 E76 E82 EA1 EA2 EM11 EM5 FR82 HR3 PI4 RA27 RA3 RA803 RA82 RA827 SQ21 T11 T20 T26 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire 05/19/2024 INC#0178

item.description: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0178; 04:15AM; 1624 Schrader Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3QPLHye" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3QPLHye</a>; #Hollywood; This fire is now categorized as a Major Emergency, with 126 LAFD Firefighters assigned, relentlessly battling heavy fire in the sub-floor/basement, both above ground floors and attic of a vacant and abandoned two-story hotel. No injuries reported.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E203 EA1 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E3 E41 E61 E76 E82 EM11 EM5 FR82 HR3 RA27 RA3 RA803 RA82 RA827 SQ21 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey
